etymology.description: 家(home; family) + 乡(native place; countryside) = hometown
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of one’s home/family with one’s native place to refer to where a person comes from. Conveys emotional attachment to the place of origin.
etymology.simplification: 乡 is the simplified form of 鄉, adopted to reduce stroke count and standardize the frequent 乡 component for easier, faster writing.

examples.chinese: 我很想念我的家乡(我很想念我的家鄉)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hěn xiǎngniàn wǒ de jiāxiāng.

examples.chinese: 他大学毕业后回到家乡(他大學畢業後回到家鄉)，在那儿工作(在那兒工作)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dàxué bìyè hòu huídào jiāxiāng, zài nàr gōngzuò.
examples.english: After graduating from college, he returned to his hometown and worked there.

examples.chinese: 家乡的味道让人难忘(家鄉的味道讓人難忘)。
examples.pinyin: Jiāxiāng de wèidào ràng rén nánwàng.
examples.english: The flavors of home are unforgettable.
